channel.title: Ian LeCorbeau
channel.description: BDFL @ Ragnarok, cybersecurity and infosec zealot, privacy/freedom advocate and strength training enthusiast.

item.title: Ragnarok and OpenBSD's ksh
item.description:
The reason Ragnarok uses OpenBSD's ksh as the default interactive shell is because A) I like it (obviously) and it's what I use, and B) It does most of what bash does, yet with a MUCH smaller and saner code base (which helps with security, on top of it).

For Debian/Devuan users who want to try it, a .deb package is available outside the Ragnarok repo, or the source can just be cloned and built manually (it requires Clang by default, though).

Users of other Linux distributions (or who don't have access to Clang on Debian) should just grab the source from Ibara's github repo.

item.title: Tip: Run Brave Browser Without JIT
item.description: Security tip: run your browser without JS Just-In-Time compilation to prevent potential code injection, JIT spraying and arbitrary code execution attacks.

item.title: "Off Day" Training
item.description: Off days don't have to be completely off. In fact, using them to do extra workouts is often the best way to build consistency. This is a simple yet effective workout to do on non-training days (or as a training day for those who don't normally train).

item.title: Use mmdebstrap to install Debian (and more)
item.description: This is a follow up to my Debian Deboostrap Install guide posted a few years back.
